content: LLVM 14 has been branched today. I started working on a rebase.
Let me know if anything comes up. I'm curious to see how much our chasing of LLVM HEAD during the development cycle has changed things.
PR is at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93577. Looking fairly well so far.
@durin42 It does help -- at least no need to adjust our LLVM bindings or fix codegen tests.

Unfortunately it's not the whole story either, because there's usually problems related to the wide range of targets (including adversarial ones like windows and macos), some of them using toolchains from the stone age.
Looks like we're going to switch to a faster point release cadence: https://discourse.llvm.org/t/llvm-14-0-1-schedule-and-release-updates/61227/14?u=nikic
So we'll probably want to merge those in rather than do a rebase every time.
